intro: Artanthe barclayana, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes罂粟 and other related species. The plant features showy, bright orange or red flowers that bloom in spring and early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Artanthe barclayana is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
